intro: Heteropterys arcuata, commonly known as the wavy-leaf huito, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with wavy margins and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
